page.title: 02A CHILDS DAY IN MENDLESHAM
page.content: We get up on school days between 7-o-clock and 8-o-clock. We get washed and dressed and have breakfast which might be something like cereal or fried eggs or sausages. Then we get ready for school. Some of us are taken to school on the mini-bus if we live a long way from school but some of us walk or cycle. We start lessons at 9-o-clock. We do maths, reading, writing, art, music, or P.E. In the summer we go swimming. In the middle of the morning we have a break and play outside. Lunch time is at twelve o-clock. Some children have a school dinner which is cooked in the canteen, others take a packed lunch. School finishes at 3.15.p.m. When we go home we watch television or go out to play. Then we go in for tea. We go to bed at about 9-o-clock.
